docs.title: Ktor-E-Commerce
docs.text: Ktor-E-Commerce is a high-performance backend solution designed for e-commerce applications built with ktor. This backend leverages the power of Kotlin to provide a robust, scalable, and efficient service for handling your e-commerce needs.

docs.title: 1. Role-Based Access Control
docs.text:
• Customer Role: Shoppers with basic access to browse and make purchases.
  • Seller Role: Vendors can list products and manage their inventory.
  • Admin Role: Administrators have full control over the platform.

docs.title: 2. User Accounts and Authentication
docs.text:
• User Registration: Allow customers to create accounts. Users can register with the same email for different roles (customer and seller).
  • User Authentication: Implement JWT-based authentication for user sessions.
  • User Profiles: Enable users to view and update their profiles.

docs.title: 3. Product Management
docs.text:
• Product Listings: Create, update, and delete product listings.
  • Categories: Organize products into categories and brands for easy navigation.
  • Inventory Control: Keep track of product availability and stock levels.

docs.title: 4. Shopping Cart and Checkout
docs.text:
• Shopping Cart: Add and remove products, update quantities, and calculate totals.
  • Checkout: Streamline the checkout process for quick and secure payments.

docs.title: 5. Order Management
docs.text:
• Order Processing: Handle order creation, status updates, and order history.
  • Payment Integration: Integrate with popular payment gateways for seamless transactions.

docs.title: 6. Scalability and Performance
docs.text:
• Asynchronous Processing: Leverage Ktor's async capabilities for high performance.
  • Load Balancing: Easily scale your application to accommodate increased traffic.

docs.title: 7. Security
docs.text:
• JWT Tokens: Implement JSON Web Tokens for secure authentication.
  • Input Validation: Protect against common web vulnerabilities like SQL injection and cross-site scripting (XSS).

docs.title: Architecture
docs.text: Fig. Onion Architecture

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
• JAVA 11 (or latest)
  • PostgreSQL (latest)

docs.title: Clone the repository
docs.text:
git clone git@github.com:piashcse/ktor-E-Commerce.git

Note: some installation instructions are for mac, for windows/linux please install accordingly.

docs.title: Postgres Setup
docs.text:
• Create a database in postgreSQL
  • Change your db name, user, and password in resources/hikari.properties and replace them accordingly.
dataSource.user=postgres
dataSource.password=p123
dataSource.databaseName=ktor-1.0.0

docs.title: PgAdmin Setup
docs.text:
On Terminal

brew install --cask pgadmin4

Open PgAdmin

In the "Create - Server" dialog that appears, fill in the following information:

General tab:

  • Name: Give your server a name (e.g., "Ktor Ecommerce App")

Connection tab:

  • Host name/address: localhost (if your PostgreSQL server is on the same machine)
  • Port: 5432 (default PostgreSQL port)
  • Maintenance database: postgres (default database)
  • Username: piashcse (the user you created for your application)
  • Password: p123 (the password you set for piashcse)

docs.title: Run the project
docs.text:
On Terminal

./gradlew run

object SmtpServer {

    const val EMAIL_SUBJECT = "Forget Password"
    const val SENDING_EMAIL = "your-email@gmail.com" // Sender email displayed to recipients
}

docs.title: Authentication API
docs.text:
This documentation provides comprehensive details for the Authentication API endpoints. The API supports user registration, login, password management, and email verification functionality with support for multiple user types (customer, seller, admin).

Base URL: http://localhost:8080

docs.title: Auth Endpoints
docs.text: Method Endpoint Description Authentication Required POST /auth/login Authenticate user and receive access token No POST /auth/register Register a new user account No GET /auth/otp-verification Verify OTP for account activation No GET /auth/forget-password Request password reset verification code No GET /auth/reset-password Reset password using verification code No PUT /auth/change-password Change password for authenticated user Yes

docs.title: 1. User Login
docs.text:
POST /auth/login

Authenticate a user and receive an access token for subsequent API calls.

docs.title: Request Parameters
docs.text: Parameter Type Required Description email string Yes User's email address password string Yes User's password userType string Yes Type of user (customer, seller, admin)

docs.title: Example Request
docs.text:
curl -X 'POST' \
  'http://localhost:8080/auth/login' \
  -H 'accept: application/json' \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -d '{
    "email": "customer@gmail.com",
    "password": "p1234",
    "userType": "customer"
  }'

docs.title: Example Response
docs.text:
{
  "isSuccess": true,
  "statusCode": {
    "value": 200,
    "description": "OK"
  },
  "data": {
    "user": {
      "id": "ce563774-d3d5-442e-ad1a-b884bb0a53f0",
      "email": "customer@gmail.com",
      "userType": "customer"
    },
    "accessToken": "eyJhbGciOiJIUzUxMiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..."
  }
}

docs.title: Response Fields
docs.text: Field Type Description isSuccess boolean Indicates if the request was successful statusCode object HTTP status code and description data.user object User information data.accessToken string JWT token for authentication

docs.title: 2. User Registration
docs.text:
POST /auth/register

Register a new user account. Users can register with the same email for different roles.

docs.title: Key Features
docs.text:
• Multiple user types supported (customer, seller, admin)
  • Same email can be used for different user types
  • Automatic email verification process

docs.title: Request Parameters
docs.text: Parameter Type Required Description email string Yes User's email address password string Yes User's password userType string Yes Type of user (customer, seller, admin)

  'http://localhost:8080/auth/register' \
  -H 'accept: application/json' \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -d '{
    "email": "piash@gmail.com",
    "password": "p1234",
    "userType": "admin"

    "email": "piash@gmail.com"
  }
}

docs.title: 3. OTP Verification
docs.text:
GET /auth/otp-verification

Verify the OTP (One-Time Password) sent to user's email during registration.

docs.title: Query Parameters
docs.text: Parameter Type Required Description userId string Yes User ID received during registration otp string Yes OTP code sent to user's email

docs.title: Example Request
docs.text:
curl -X 'GET' \
  'http://localhost:8080/auth/otp-verification?userId=3842e19b-2608-40f8-98bd-6a6b43939fec&otp=560674d' \
  -H 'accept: application/json'

docs.title: Example Response

{
  "isSuccess": true,
  "statusCode": {
    "value": 200,
    "description": "OK"
  },
  "data": true

docs.title: 4. Forget Password
docs.text:
GET /auth/forget-password

Request a password reset verification code. The code will be sent to the user's email address.

docs.title: Query Parameters
docs.text: Parameter Type Required Description email string Yes User's email address userType string No Specify user type if multiple accounts exist with same email

docs.title: Example Request
docs.text:
curl -X 'GET' \
  'http://localhost:8080/auth/forget-password?email=piash@gmail.com&userType=customer' \
  -H 'accept: application/json'

docs.title: Example Response
docs.text:

  "isSuccess": true,
  "statusCode": {
    "value": 200,
    "description": "OK"
  },
  "data": "verification code sent to piash@gmail.com"
}

docs.title: 5. Reset Password
docs.text:
GET /auth/reset-password

Reset user password using the verification code sent via email.

docs.title: Query Parameters
docs.text: Parameter Type Required Description email string Yes User's email address otp string Yes Verification code from email newPassword string Yes New password userType string No Specify user type if multiple accounts exist

docs.title: Example Request
docs.text:
curl -X 'GET' \
  'http://localhost:8080/auth/reset-password?email=piash599%40gmail.com&otp=9889&newPassword=p1234&userType=customer' \
  -H 'accept: application/json'

docs.title: Example Response
docs.text:
{
  "isSuccess": true,
  "statusCode": {
    "value": 200,
    "description": "OK"
  },
  "data": "Password change successful"
}

docs.title: 6. Change Password
docs.text:
PUT /auth/change-password

Change password for an authenticated user. Requires valid access token.

docs.title: Query Parameters
docs.text: Parameter Type Required Description oldPassword string Yes Current password newPassword string Yes New password

docs.title: Headers
docs.text: Header Value Required Authorization Bearer <access_token> Yes

docs.title: Example Request
docs.text:
curl -X 'PUT' \
  'http://localhost:8080/auth/change-password?oldPassword=p1234&newPassword=newp1234' \
  -H 'accept: application/json' \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzUxMiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9...'

docs.title: Example Response
docs.text:
{
  "isSuccess": true,
  "statusCode": {
    "value": 200,
    "description": "OK"
  },
  "data": "Password has been changed"
}

docs.title: Response Format
docs.text:
All API responses follow a consistent format:

{
  "isSuccess": boolean,
  "statusCode": {
    "value": number,
    "description": string
  },
  "data": any
}

docs.title: Response Fields
docs.text: Field Type Description isSuccess boolean Indicates if the operation was successful statusCode.value number HTTP status code statusCode.description string HTTP status description data any Response data (varies by endpoint)

docs.title: Error Handling
docs.text:
The API returns appropriate HTTP status codes and error messages:

Status Code Description 200 OK - Request successful 400 Bad Request - Invalid parameters 401 Unauthorized - Invalid or missing authentication 404 Not Found - Resource not found 500 Internal Server Error - Server error

docs.title: Brand API
docs.text:
This documentation provides comprehensive details for the Brand API endpoints. The API supports creating, retrieving, updating, and deleting brands within the platform. Brands are independent entities that can be associated with products and managed by administrators or authorized users.

Base URL: http://localhost:8080

docs.title: Authentication
docs.text:
All Brand endpoints require Bearer token authentication. Include the access token in the Authorization header:

Authorization: Bearer <your_access_token>

docs.title: Brand Endpoints
docs.text: Method Endpoint Description Authentication Required POST /brand Create a new brand Yes GET /brand Retrieve list of brands Yes PUT /brand/{id} Update an existing brand Yes DELETE /brand/{id} Delete a brand Yes

docs.title: 1. Create Brand
docs.text:
POST /brand

Create a new brand with a specified name.

docs.title: Query Parameters
docs.text: Parameter Type Required Description name string Yes Name of the brand

docs.title: Headers
docs.text: Header Value Required Authorization Bearer <access_token> Yes

docs.title: Example Request
docs.text:
curl -X 'POST' \
  'http://localhost:8080/brand?name=Nike' \
  -H 'accept: application/json' \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzUxMiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9...' \

docs.title: Cart API
docs.text:
This documentation provides comprehensive details for the Cart API endpoints. The API supports adding products to cart, retrieving cart items, updating quantities, and removing items from the shopping cart. All cart operations are user-specific and require authentication to ensure cart data privacy and security.

Base URL: http://localhost:8080

docs.title: Authentication
docs.text:
All Cart endpoints require Bearer token authentication. Include the access token in the Authorization header:

Authorization: Bearer <your_access_token>

docs.title: Cart Management Endpoints
docs.text: Method Endpoint Description Authentication Required POST /cart Add product to cart Yes GET /cart Retrieve cart items Yes PUT /cart Update product quantity in cart Yes DELETE /cart Remove specific product from cart Yes DELETE /cart/all Clear entire cart Yes

docs.title: 1. Add Product to Cart
docs.text:
POST /cart

Add a product to the user's shopping cart with specified quantity. If the product already exists in the cart, this will add to the existing quantity.

docs.title: Query Parameters
docs.text: Parameter Type Required Description productId string Yes UUID of the product to add to cart quantity number Yes Quantity of the product to add (must be positive)

docs.title: Headers
docs.text: Header Value Required Authorization Bearer <access_token> Yes

docs.title: Example Request
docs.text:
curl -X 'POST' \
  'http://localhost:8080/cart?productId=5b24d429-c981-47c8-9318-f4d61dd2c1a4&quantity=1' \
  -H 'accept: application/json' \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzUxMiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9...' \
  -d ''

docs.title: Example Response
docs.text:
{

  },

    "quantity": 1
  }
}

docs.title: Response Fields
docs.text: Field Type Description productId string UUID of the product added to cart quantity number Total quantity of this product now in cart

  • Consent records include full audit trail information

  • Consent timestamps use ISO 8601 format in UTC

docs.title: Wishlist API
docs.text:
This documentation provides comprehensive details for the Wishlist API endpoints. The API supports adding products to wishlist, retrieving user's wishlist items, and removing products from wishlist. Wishlist functionality is user-specific and requires authentication to access personal wishlist data.

Base URL: http://localhost:8080

docs.title: Authentication
docs.text:
All Wishlist endpoints require Bearer token authentication. Include the access token in the Authorization header:

Authorization: Bearer <your_access_token>
